writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
The morning sun seeped through the curtains, casting a warm, golden light across the room. I blinked slowly, savoring the tranquility of our shared sanctuary. The sheets were soft against my skin, and beside me, Nico was still curled up like a cat, his dark hair tousled and falling over his eyes. 

"Morning, sunshine," I murmured, brushing the strands away from his face and planting a gentle kiss on his forehead. 

Nico groaned, burrowing deeper into the blankets. "Nope. Not today, Solace. Today's a stay-in-bed kind of day."

I chuckled, already anticipating the playful skirmish that followed. "You say that every morning, Nico. And every morning, you lose the war."

He peeked out from under the covers, eyes glinting with mischief. "That's because you cheat. Using kisses as weapons is totally unfair."

"All's fair in love and war," I grinned, leaning down to steal another kiss. He responded with a swift pillow to my face, and I laughed, catching it before it could do any real damage. 

We tussled for a while, laughter mingling with the sound of rustling sheets. Eventually, I managed to extricate myself from the cocoon of warmth, pulling Nico along with me. 

"Alright, alright," he relented, sitting up and rubbing the sleep from his eyes. "But only because I'm starving."

As we stumbled into the kitchen, the playful banter continued. I flicked on the coffee maker while Nico rummaged through the fridge, his dramatic flair ever-present. 

"Is it just me," he began, "or should we add a little magic to our mornings?"

I paused, intrigued. "Magic? Like, demigod magic?"

"Exactly," Nico said, eyes lighting up with that familiar spark of mischief. "I was thinking, why not have a mythical breakfast? You know, like ambrosia pancakes or nectar smoothies."

I laughed, picturing the chaos of attempting to cook with enchanted ingredients. "You want to turn breakfast into a quest?"

"Why not? It's in our blood," he replied, grinning. "Plus, it could be a fun way to honor our heritage. And think about it—what other couple can say they have a unicorn delivering their morning coffee?"

The idea was so absurd, so perfectly Nico, that I couldn't help but agree. "Alright, I'm in. But only if we can play some music while we cook. No way am I slaying mythical pancakes without a soundtrack."

Nico smirked, pretending to consider it. "Fine, but I'm picking the playlist."

We debated over music choices while gathering ingredients, our voices mingling with the soft hum of morning life. The room was filled with warmth, laughter, and the smell of brewing coffee. It was our own little world, where magic was as simple as the love shared between us.

The conversation took on a more serious note as we cooked, the whimsical suggestion turning into a deeper exploration of our bond. In each movement, each shared glance, was a promise—a reminder of why our mornings mattered so much.

As we sat down to our first mythical breakfast, the sunlight danced across the table, illuminating Nico's smile. His suggestion had brought a new layer of magic to our routine, a playful nod to the life we led and the love we cherished.

In that moment, I realized that every morning with Nico was a new adventure, and I couldn't wait to see where his next suggestion would take us.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I leaned against the kitchen counter, stirring a pot of spaghetti sauce with one hand and holding Will's phone in the other. Dinner was bubbling away, filling the apartment with the rich smell of tomatoes and basil, and I had a good fifteen minutes before anything needed my attention again. Will had left his phone on the table, as he often did, insisting I could look through it anytime. It had become a bit of a joke between us, my supposed lack of curiosity about his messages and apps.

But tonight, out of a mix of boredom and mischief, I decided to take him up on his offer. Besides, scrolling through his photos was bound to be more entertaining than watching pasta water boil. I tapped open the gallery, expecting to find the usual mix of celestial-themed memes, pictures of his patients at the infirmary, and perhaps a few selfies.

What I didn't expect was the folder labeled "Sunshine Moments" with a little sun emoji next to it. Intrigued, I opened it. And there they were—candid photos of me. Dozens of them.

In one, I was asleep on the couch, mouth slightly open, hair a mess, but the golden light from the window painted me in the softest of halos. Another showed me laughing, mid-laugh actually, caught in that awkward yet joyful moment when Percy had told one of his famously terrible jokes. There was one where I was reading, completely absorbed, my brow furrowed in concentration. Each photo captured something—something I didn’t even realize was special.

“Enjoying the show?” Will’s voice cut through my thoughts, and I looked up to see him leaning against the doorframe, arms crossed, a knowing smile on his lips.

“Oh, you know,” I shrugged, “just discovering my secret life as a muse.”

Will chuckled, crossing the room to stand beside me. “I thought you’d find those eventually.”

“Eventually being when?” I raised an eyebrow, trying to sound mock-offended. “You were planning to reveal my modeling career posthumously?”

He snorted, taking the phone from my hand and scrolling through the photos with a tender smile. “You didn’t even notice, did you?”

“Notice what?” I asked, genuinely curious now.

“That you’re beautiful in every single moment,” he said, so casually, like he was stating a fact as simple as the sky being blue or the sun setting in the west. 

I felt my face heat up, a flush spreading across my cheeks. “You’re such a sap.”

“And you love it,” he countered, nudging me with his shoulder.

I rolled my eyes, but I couldn’t hide my grin. “Maybe I do.”

We stood there for a moment, the sauce bubbling softly behind us, the kitchen warm and cozy. Will wrapped an arm around my shoulders, pulling me into his side. “I wanted to capture all the ways you’re you, Nico. All those little moments you don’t see but make me love you more every day.”

I looked at him then, really looked at him, and saw the truth in his eyes. “I guess I’ll have to start a candid collection of my own,” I murmured, leaning my head against his shoulder.

“Good luck with that,” he teased. “I’m notoriously hard to photograph.”

“I’ll manage,” I promised, and kissed him, sealing the moment in a way no camera ever could.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
“You know, this isn’t what I imagined for date night,” Will said, eyeing the cluttered vanity table filled with brushes, palettes, and mysterious tubes of color. The room was a riot of creativity—posters of mythical creatures and celebrities adorned the walls, and twinkling fairy lights cast a warm glow across the chaos.

“Oh, come on, Will!” Nico pleaded, a mischievous grin spreading across his face as he twirled a makeup brush with a flourish that would put any magician to shame. “Just one video. It’ll be fun! And besides, you owe me after that time you dragged me into that karaoke contest.”

Will rolled his eyes, though a smile tugged at his lips. “That was different. I was helping the camp raise funds. This is... well, this is you wanting to turn me into the next big TikTok sensation.”

Nico laughed, playfully bumping Will with his hip. “Exactly! And I promise you’ll look fabulous. Maybe like a modern-day Apollo. Or perhaps something more mythical?”

Will sighed, his reluctance melting under Nico’s infectious enthusiasm. “Alright, alright. But if you make me look like some kind of rainbow unicorn, I’m going to demand ice cream as compensation.”

Nico clapped his hands in delight, already envisioning the transformation. “Deal! Now, sit still and let the magic happen.”

As Nico began his work, the air filled with light-hearted banter. “You know, I’ve always thought you’d make a great centaur,” Nico mused, dabbing shimmering gold onto Will’s eyelids.

“Gee, thanks. I’ve always wanted to be half-horse,” Will retorted with a smirk, earning a gentle nudge from Nico.

They continued in this vein, laughter punctuating the air as Nico layered colors and textures. He narrated each step with exaggerated flair, describing the brushes as wands and the makeup as magical potions. “And now, a touch of celestial blush to highlight those cheekbones. You’ll be the envy of every demigod this side of Olympus.”

When Nico finally stepped back, he held up a mirror with a flourish. Will blinked, his reflection staring back at him with wide eyes. “Wow,” was all he managed to say.

There, in the mirror, was not just his face but an elaborate depiction of a mythical creature. Nico had transformed him into a strikingly handsome Medusa, complete with shimmering scales painted artfully across his cheeks and green serpentine eyes that seemed almost alive.

Nico burst out laughing at Will’s expression. “I promised you’d look fabulous, didn’t I?”

Will chuckled, shaking his head in disbelief. “You certainly delivered on the unexpected. I can’t decide if I’m more impressed or terrified.”

Nico wrapped his arms around Will from behind, resting his chin on his shoulder. “Definitely impressed. And maybe a little terrified at how good you look.”

Will turned his head, planting a soft kiss on Nico’s cheek. “Alright, makeup artist extraordinaire, you win. But I’m still holding you to that ice cream promise.”

They both laughed, the sound filling the room with warmth and affection. As the camera continued to record, capturing the transformation and the playful exchange that followed, they knew this would be a date night to remember—a testament to their shared humor and love.

“I think we might have just started a new trend,” Nico said, grinning widely.

Will nodded, pulling Nico closer. “As long as it involves us, I’m all in.”

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
The Labyrinth was a mess of cold stone walls echoing with whispers of the past, a maze that twisted itself into Nico's daily routine. Every step felt like a calculated risk, and his map had become a lifeline, though it betrayed him more often than not. He muttered under his breath, cursing Daedalus's ingenuity and his own luck. His fingers traced the worn edges of the map as if it could somehow reveal its secrets if he just tried hard enough.

"And here I thought the Labyrinth was supposed to be fun," Nico grumbled, his voice bouncing off the walls.

He rounded a corner, his mind half-lost in thoughts of escape plans and what he might have for dinner if he ever found his way out. That's when he nearly stumbled over a boy—freckles scattering across his cheeks like constellations, a mischievous glint in his eye as if he had emerged straight from a dream or possibly a nightmare, depending on your perspective.

"Whoa! Watch it, Mr. Gloom-and-Doom," the boy said, grinning widely. "You look like you’ve seen a ghost—or maybe just your own reflection."

Nico blinked. "Who are you?"

"Name's Will," the boy replied, brushing imaginary dust off his futuristic-looking jacket. It shimmered under the dim light, fabric too smooth, too new for the ancient stones surrounding them. "And before you ask, yes, I’m from the future. Your future, to be precise."

Nico arched an eyebrow, skepticism wrapping around him like a shield. "Right. And I’m the King of Olympus."

"That would make you Zeus. But nope, you’re just Nico, my future boyfriend," Will said with a shrug, as if time travel and future romances were as mundane as morning coffee.

"Future boyfriend?" Nico repeated, his voice laced with sarcasm. "Let me guess, you’ve got a flying car parked outside too?"

Will chuckled, the sound warm and surprisingly reassuring. "Not quite. But I do have this." He reached into his pocket, pulling out a small, sleek device that lit up with swirling colors. "It's a communicator. Kind of like a phone, but, you know, a million times cooler."

Nico eyed the gadget, a mix of fascination and disbelief dancing in his gaze. "And you’re using this... communicator to find me? In the Labyrinth?"

"Pretty much," Will said, leaning casually against the wall as if they were chatting in a park rather than a mythical maze. "I was curious. Wanted to see the infamous Nico di Angelo in action."

"Infamous, huh?" Nico couldn’t help the small smile tugging at his lips. There was something charming about Will’s boldness, his confidence. 

Their conversation flowed, dialogue weaving between them like threads of fate, revealing bits of who they were. Will was bold, quirky, and undeniably confident. He spoke of future trends—hoverboards, climate-controlled jackets, music that played directly in your head. Each word painted a picture of a world Nico couldn’t quite imagine but found himself wanting to explore.

"So, what am I like in this future of yours?" Nico asked, a mix of curiosity and trepidation in his voice.

"Still brooding, still tough as nails," Will said, his eyes softening. "But happy. Happier than you are now. Because you let people in, especially me."

Nico studied Will, the boy’s sincerity cutting through his defenses. The idea of a future where he could be happy, where he could let someone in, felt like a fragile dream he hadn’t dared to entertain.

"Why are you telling me all this?" Nico asked quietly.

"Because, Nico," Will said, stepping closer, "sometimes knowing there’s light at the end of the tunnel makes the journey a little less daunting."

Nico felt the weight of those words settle around him, their truth undeniable. Maybe it was the Labyrinth, maybe it was Will, but something shifted within him, an acceptance of possibilities he hadn’t considered before.

"Alright, future boyfriend," Nico said, a teasing lilt to his voice, "lead the way. Let’s see if we can find our way out of this mess."

Will laughed, bright and full of promise. Together, they ventured deeper into the Labyrinth, the paths less menacing with every step they took side by side.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
It's one of those nights where sleep seems like a distant memory. The clock ticks loudly in the silence, each second a reminder of the battles that still rage within our minds. I watch the hands circle slowly, casting long shadows across the kitchen walls. The refrigerator hums a low, comforting tune, a constant in the stillness, much like the steady presence of Nico beside me.

“Remember when we thought we’d never see the stars again?” Nico’s voice breaks the quiet, laced with a hint of sarcasm that’s become a familiar balm. He’s leaning against the counter, arms crossed, eyes slightly unfocused as he stares into the past.

“Yeah,” I reply, a smile tugging at my lips. “And now we’re here, in our very own dance hall. The kitchen dance floor—only the safest place we’ve ever been.”

Nico chuckles, a sound that feels like sunlight breaking through clouds. “You know, I always imagined our life post-Tartarus to be... less domestic and more,” he gestures vaguely, “heroic.”

“Heroic?” I ask, raising an eyebrow. “Like fighting mythical creatures while making breakfast?”

He grins, and it’s as if the kitchen light casts an extra layer of warmth around us. “Exactly. But I guess this is nice too. Less life-threatening.”

The radio, forgotten until now, starts playing a soft tune, the kind that wraps around you like a warm blanket. It’s a song we both know but never tire of hearing. It’s modern, a gentle reminder that time has moved on even when we sometimes feel stuck.

I move closer, extending a hand. “Dance with me?”

He pretends to think about it, a dramatic flair in his eyes that’s uniquely Nico. “Well, seeing as our lives aren’t in immediate danger...”

I laugh, pulling him into my arms. We sway gently, feet shuffling on the worn tiles. Nico’s head rests against my shoulder, and I can feel his breath, steady and calming, syncing with the rhythm of the music.

“In this moment,” I whisper, “it’s just us. No past, no future. Just now.”

He nods, his grip tightening around me. “In this moment,” he echoes, and I feel the weight of his words, the promise of healing and love.

The kitchen, with its soft glow and mundane familiarity, becomes our haven. The darkness outside presses against the windows, a distant memory of shadows and fear. But here, in this light, we find warmth and safety.

“Do you think we’ll ever stop being afraid?” Nico asks, his voice small but hopeful.

I pause, considering. “Maybe not entirely. But we’re getting better at finding the light, don’t you think?”

He looks up, and there’s a softness in his eyes, a reflection of the gentleness we’ve cultivated together. “Yeah, I think so.”

We continue to move, the music guiding us. Our kitchen waltz is a dance of healing, a ritual that has become a testament to our resilience. It’s whimsical and playful, transforming the ordinary space into something magical, a retreat from the world outside.

As the song fades, Nico leans back slightly, meeting my gaze. “We’ve come a long way, haven’t we?”

I nod, feeling a swell of gratitude. “And we’ll keep going. Together.”

His smile is a quiet promise, a shared understanding that whatever comes next, we’ll face it side by side. In this moment, and every moment after, we are enough.
